alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Gibson; Knox; Pike (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 23 at 9:52PM EDT until May 24 at 2:45PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... White River at Hazleton and Petersburg. .Recent rainfall across central Indiana has resulted in minor flooding along the White River. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Petersburg. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Flooding affects low agricultural lands, low oil fields and closes Bottoms Rd...Brothers Rd and East Govenors Road in Knox County. In agricultural season...farmers are concerned at this stage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 PM EDT Monday /8:30 PM CDT Monday/ the stage was 16.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 PM EDT Monday /8:30 PM CDT Monday/ was 18.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 4.5 feet Thursday, June 02. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
